Motivation.name: Advance
Motivation.Description: Motivated by the experience of making progress as a series of goals are accomplished.

Characteristics.Strengths: Brings new ideas and possibilities, creates new trends and movements, builds momentum, finds ways forward when stuck.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments that promote personal growth, have innovation and cutting-edge strategies, vision for the future, and goal-driven culture.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Environments where upward movement is not rewarded, products are commoditized, or career paths are undefined.
Characteristics.FlipSide: The need for forward movement could cause them to miss present day opportunities and lead to discontent in their current position.

Motivation.name: Architect
Motivation.Description: Motivated by creating a plan using technical expertise, then advising and overseeing specialists in the execution of that plan.

Characteristics.Strengths: Brings clarity and direction, crafts comprehensive plans, translates ideas into workable plans, builds complex structures.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments where master plans are developed, specialized teams need oversight, visions become reality through planning, and technical expertise is necessary.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Environments without specialized teams, where building or creating is not the focus, or there's no opportunity for leadership.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Due to their expertise and big-picture understanding, they could appear dismissive or arrogant when responding to those without similar capabilities.

Motivation.name: Be Key
Motivation.Description: Motivated to be a key person who holds things together and gives meaning and/or direction to the work.

Characteristics.Strengths: Provides direction, builds momentum, plays critical roles in organizational success, takes on challenging roles.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Project-oriented environments, team-focused work, opportunities to lead and give direction, roles where they can stand out.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Environments where they are one of many doing the same tasks, authoritative or "flat" operations, highly collaborative settings.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Their desire to be key and do it all could lead to burnout and minimizing others' contributions.

Motivation.name: Be Unique
Motivation.Description: Motivated to be distinctive by displaying a talent, quality or aspect that is extraordinary and different from others.

Characteristics.Strengths: Innovates, unafraid to be different, sees distinction where others don't, has cutting-edge ideas.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments that promote autonomy and flexibility, allow creativity, offer opportunities to stand out, and value novelty.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Highly structured environments, high-volume or process-oriented work, roles where many people do the same work.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Their desire to be unique could lead to rebelling against conformity or introducing unrealistic ideas just to be different.

Motivation.name: Collaborate
Motivation.Description: Motivated to be closely involved with others in contributing to common goals and vision.

Characteristics.Strengths: Clarifies team vision/mission, incorporates individuals into teams, encourages community values, builds relationships.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments where group work is common, social/relational aspects are promoted, there are shared goals and collaboration, and communication is essential.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Environments where independent work is primary, authority and rank are important, or there's little time for relating to others.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Their instinct to work with others could make them appear judgmental of individualists or prioritize group needs over their own.

Motivation.name: Comprehend and Express
Motivation.Description: Motivated to understand, define, and then communicate their insights.

Characteristics.Strengths: Communicates complexities clearly, pushes knowledge boundaries, models beliefs, develops explanatory models.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments where learning is part of work, opportunities to present knowledge exist, high expertise is required, and conceptual work needs application.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Simple or monotonous work environments, where personal expression isn't essential, or where time and idea integration are constrained.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Their hunger for knowledge can leave them bored when not learning, and they may struggle with decision-making due to analysis needs.

Motivation.name: Demonstrate Learning
Motivation.Description: Motivated to learn how to do something new and then show that they can do it.

Characteristics.Strengths: Inspires others to try new things, mentors through modeling, puts ideas into practice, demonstrates knowledge effectively.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments where learning and personal growth are essential, learning is applied, there are opportunities to present findings, and teaching is possible.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Environments with less flexibility for change, where work is rigidly defined, individualism isn't valued, or advancement opportunities are limited.
Characteristics.FlipSide: May feel discontent unless continuously learning and might be frustrated if others don't adopt what they've learned.

Motivation.name: Design
Motivation.Description: Motivated to take a vision or "big picture" plan and giving it form, feeling, and depth through a creative design.

Characteristics.Strengths: Gives artistic expression to ideas, elevates appeal, brings new realities to life, reveals multiple possibilities through creativity.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments where innovation and creativity are central, visions can be established through artistic mediums, in start-up phases, or where clients need vision fulfillment.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Environments where originality is prohibited, independent work isn't primary, or others significantly modify original designs.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Could become rigid about their designs, dismissing feedback, or get stuck in the design phase, struggling to complete work.

Motivation.name: Develop
Motivation.Description: Motivated to create the process of building and developing from start to finish.

Characteristics.Strengths: Advances civilization, builds from scratch, creates spaces for purposes, unifies disconnected elements.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments with opportunities to engineer products or processes, take projects from conception to completion, or transform complex processes into platforms.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Environments focused on fixing or improving existing things, where projects remain unfinished, or tasks are overly simple and established.
Characteristics.FlipSide: May want hands-on involvement in every project stage, even if it's beyond their role, and might distance themselves from projects not requiring ongoing development.

Motivation.name: Do It Right
Motivation.Description: Motivated to consistently set up or follow certain standards, procedures and principles.

Characteristics.Strengths: Models character and commitment, produces precise and reliable work, sets standards for change and justice.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments with precisely defined roles, emphasis on detail and process, focus on measuring outcomes, and clear values and beliefs.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Environments requiring high adaptability, where precision or quality assurance isn't critical, or where standards and processes aren't highly valued.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Due to strong convictions, may struggle to compromise and be overly strict or critical of others with different perspectives.

Motivation.name: Establish
Motivation.Description: Motivated to lay secure foundations and to be foundational.

Characteristics.Strengths: Leaves impactful legacies, builds confidence in uncertain times, solves foundational problems, provides solutions to core issues.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments valuing enduring creations, loyalty, clearly defined roles and accountability, and emphasis on process and planning.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Ambiguous environments lacking structure, roles requiring cross-functional work, or settings with collective, open-ended decision-making.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Might dismiss new ideas or innovations due to their preference for strong foundations, and could lack respect for less experienced leaders.

Motivation.name: Evoke Recognition
Motivation.Description: Motivated to capture the attention and interest of others.

Characteristics.Strengths: Draws out appreciation for beauty, raises recognition for causes, takes on inspiring roles, impacts others through aesthetics.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Competitive environments, settings with clear audiences, where impact is measurable, and roles with performance or public relations elements.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Environments where individual contributions don't stand out, aren't easily measured, or where being central isn't highlighted.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Their passion for standing out may lead to losing awareness of others' need to shine and disappointment if they don't receive expected recognition.

Motivation.name: Excel
Motivation.Description: Motivated to give their absolute best as they exceed performance and expectations.

Characteristics.Strengths: Contributes as a high performer, breaks through limitations, sets standards for healthy competition, raises quality benchmarks.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments that reward exceeding expectations, equate competition with thriving, offer opportunities to stand out, and brand high quality.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Environments where results aren't "A-level", excellence isn't essential, or products and services are primarily value-oriented.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Could become excessively competitive and overly concerned with personal performance, resulting in unrealistic standards.

Motivation.name: Experience the Ideal
Motivation.Description: Motivated to give concrete expression to certain concepts, visions, or values that are important.

Characteristics.Strengths: Innovates to enrich life, drives positive social change, models living out values, brings big dreams to life.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments with highly developed vision and ambition, opportunities to create practical applications for ideas, and where values are lived out.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Environments with established systems and processes, where products or services are tangible and set, or where there's little freedom to incorporate vision and values.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Can be overly idealistic, romanticizing ideas not grounded in reality, and may become discouraged if they don't see immediate change from demonstrating their values.

Motivation.name: Explore
Motivation.Description: Motivated to press beyond the existing limits of their knowledge and experience to discover what is unknown to them.

Characteristics.Strengths: Expands society's knowledge, pushes boundaries for common good, fuels imaginations, broadens horizons.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments allowing outward-bound work, involving some risk-taking, where research is core, and adventure is incorporated.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Highly prescriptive roles, environments with well-established routines, or where autonomy and independence aren't essential.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Too many constraints, routines, or over-management could become unsatisfying, hindering their ability to push boundaries of new ideas.

Motivation.name: Finish
Motivation.Description: Motivated to look at a final or finished product and know that they have met the objective they set out to accomplish.

Characteristics.Strengths: Encourages perseverance, completes tasks, finds joy in finishing loose ends, helps focus people on the future.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Project-oriented environments, settings with well-defined plans and step-by-step outlines, opportunities to review completed work.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Roles not clearly defined from start to finish, ongoing tasks without clear endpoints, or atypical work paths.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Their focus on task completion could make them easily annoyed by interruptions and unable to enjoy the process or stay present.

Motivation.name: Gain Ownership
Motivation.Description: Motivated to acquire what they want and exercise ownership or control over what is theirs.

Characteristics.Strengths: Demonstrates value of hard work and reward, shares fruits of labor, models care-taking, raises value of property or services.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments allowing business ownership or investment, partnerships with shared interests and revenue, roles with significant individual control.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Settings where things are publicly owned and controlled, no vested interest in profit is allowed, or personal oversight is lacking.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Their drive to control and own could lead to becoming possessive, over-controlling, or territorial.

Motivation.name: Identify Potential
Motivation.Description: Motivated to uncover, discover, and harness untapped possibilities and latent talent.

Characteristics.Strengths: Helps others reach full potential, uncovers hidden value, sees potential in others, envisions realistic possibilities.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments with new prospects, where possibility-thinking is promoted, cultures that bring out the best in people, and value personal growth.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Settings with little investment in developing people, focus solely on refining existing elements, or where envisioning new possibilities is stifled.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Their tendency to see potential in everything could lead to poor investments of resources that never come to fruition.

Motivation.name: Improve
Motivation.Description: Motivated to consistently make things better and enhance them.

Characteristics.Strengths: Lifts morale, creates greater efficiency, sets example to exceed status quo, attentive to improving environment.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments where skills are developed, personal growth is promoted, functionality is being enhanced, and management invests in employees.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Settings where processes aren't highly developed, there's a strong sense of tradition, or products/services are already highly developed.
Characteristics.FlipSide: May be overly critical of existing standards, pushing against the status quo, potentially stepping on others' toes with unwanted advice.

Motivation.name: Make an Impact
Motivation.Description: Motivated to shape and impact the world around them.

Characteristics.Strengths: Creates life-changing products/services, brings transformation, mentors others, introduces impactful ideas.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments focused on people, aiming for high degrees of change, welcoming individual expression, with ambitious visions.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Task and process-focused companies, settings with limited creative freedom, or where immediate results aren't visible.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Might try to make a difference when not needed, or be overly compelled to make work about their personal desires.

Motivation.name: Make It Work
Motivation.Description: Motivated to fix something that is broken or functioning improperly.

Characteristics.Strengths: Restores things to pristine condition, increases efficiency, solves major issues, brings creative solutions to challenges.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments focused on fixing relationships or things, needing problem-solving, valuing repair services, prioritizing customer service.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Settings where concepts are frequently discarded, fixing is not cost-effective, or self-awareness about problems is not valued.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Might create or exaggerate problems where none exist, and may be frustrated with routine maintenance activities.

Motivation.name: Make the Team
Motivation.Description: Motivated to measure up to standards and thereby gain acceptance into a group or team.

Characteristics.Strengths: Models high standards, promotes high-performing teams, fosters shared identity, demonstrates group norms.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments with high customer standards, valuing elite teams, focusing on performance measurement, perceived as best-in-class.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Settings where one starts at the bottom, rank isn't valued, roles are uniform, or requirements for outstanding work are undefined.
Characteristics.FlipSide: May lose sight of individuality due to group focus, feeling disappointed when the group doesn't meet expected standards.

Motivation.name: Mastery
Motivation.Description: Motivated to gain complete command of a skill, subject, procedure, technique or process.

Characteristics.Strengths: Demonstrates high performance, shows value of focus, inspires through expertise, encourages proficiency in others.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments requiring high competency, valuing complete knowledge, promoting continual learning, aiming for perfection.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Settings where deep expertise isn't required, individual contributions aren't valued, or teamwork is prioritized over individual mastery.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Drive for expertise could lead to perfectionism, slowing progress and causing constant dissatisfaction with achievements.

Motivation.name: Maximize
Motivation.Description: Motivated to get the most out of something or someone, making things as successful or great as possible.

Characteristics.Strengths: Sets high goals, takes things to highest level, elevates possibilities beyond status quo, inspires others to excel.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments desiring growth, focusing on expanding operations, valuing impact on growth, oriented towards optimal results.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Settings averse to risk or change, focused on incremental growth, or discouraging boundary-pushing.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Tendency to drive for maximum results could lead to overly ambitious, unrealistic goals, disappointing or frustrating others.

Motivation.name: Meet Needs
Motivation.Description: Motivated to identify and fulfill needs.

Characteristics.Strengths: Models selflessness, enriches others' lives, inspires sacrificial contributions, demonstrates humility.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Service-oriented environments, settings with client/customer engagement, serving-based cultures, work that makes a difference.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Environments not focused on people's needs, with limited resources for serving others, or lacking opportunities to fulfill needs.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Intent to serve others could lead to neglecting self-care, resulting in exhaustion or resentment if efforts aren't reciprocated.

Motivation.name: Meet Requirements
Motivation.Description: Motivated to fulfill expectations, giving them a deep sense of accomplishment.

Characteristics.Strengths: Brings clarity to expectations, helps others understand success benchmarks, fulfills needed work, delivers exactly what's requested.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments with clear objectives, management direction, regularly updated expectations, focus on execution and maintenance.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Settings with little performance feedback, minimal initial direction, or open-ended, self-guided objectives.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Satisfaction in meeting requirements can lead to unease or frustration when expectations are unclear or ambiguous.

Motivation.name: Meet the Challenge
Motivation.Description: Motivated to experience a sense of achievement by looking back over challenges they have met.

Characteristics.Strengths: Inspires others to tackle difficulties, models perseverance, pushes boundaries of possibility, motivates through challenges.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments with clear goals and challenges, high expectations, demanding work, and cultures of reflection and evaluation.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Settings lacking difficulty or demand, with overly simple or routine work, or where problem-solving isn't valued.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Might create unnecessary pressure or stress to challenge themselves, potentially pushing beyond current abilities.

Motivation.name: Overcome
Motivation.Description: Motivated to persevere through difficulties, oppositions or disadvantages.

Characteristics.Strengths: Inspires others to tackle the impossible, models human perseverance, blazes trails for others, unrelenting in face of fear.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments with extreme challenges, focus on "impossible" tasks, rewards for perseverance, missions defined as working against something.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Settings where work is easily accomplished, products don't serve critical outcomes, or high aspirations and risks aren't involved.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Might create or seek problems where none exist, inviting unnecessary competition, pressure, and stress into their life.

Motivation.name: Persuade
Motivation.Description: Motivated to influence someone's thoughts, feelings or behaviors.

Characteristics.Strengths: Promotes new perspectives, changes minds and hearts, unifies ideas, fosters favorable outcomes.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments where sales is critical, interaction and ideas matter, persuasion is part of the culture, and change is welcomed.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Settings without established culture/values, dominated by mass production/automation, or focused solely on process and procedure.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Tendency to focus on others' responses might lead to overselling ideas, potentially distracting from the work at hand.

Motivation.name: Realize the Vision
Motivation.Description: Motivated by taking a vision or concept and making it a reality.

Characteristics.Strengths: Brings others' dreams to life, provides practical strategies, grounds possibilities in reality, helps refine ideas.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments creating practical applications for ideas, valuing brainstorming and execution, supporting innovative strategies.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Settings that reward vision without execution, focus on mundane tasks, or have rigid structures limiting creative ideation.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Might push new ideas too quickly without considering alternatives, risking disappointment when initiatives don't materialize.

Motivation.name: Systematize
Motivation.Description: Motivated by setting up a smooth-running operation.

Characteristics.Strengths: Brings order to chaos, promotes efficient teamwork, attends to overlooked details, creates meaningful workflow.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Structured and organized environments, settings valuing process and order, opportunities to bring meaning to tasks and people.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Environments where controls aren't valued, work is overly simple, or there's little direct impact on people or projects.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Desire for smooth systems might lead to over-complicating processes, potentially causing over-extension or over-commitment.

Motivation.name: Take Charge
Motivation.Description: Motivated by being in charge of personal destiny, areas and activities, and directing areas and activities of others.

Characteristics.Strengths: Guides through uncertainty, provides direction when needed, takes responsibility in difficulties, puts reputation on line for others.
Characteristics.ThrivesIn: Environments involving critical processes, needing strong leadership, requiring precision, allowing for independence and defined domains.
Characteristics.StrugglesIn: Settings with dispersed leadership, requiring personal influence for decisions, or viewing power/authority negatively.
Characteristics.FlipSide: Natural tendency to take charge might lead to overstepping boundaries or appearing too aggressive in certain situations.
